Public

    -Self:SELF.delay:INTEGER
        SDL default value is 500;

Public

    -Self:SELF.interval:INTEGER
        SDL default velur is 30

Public

    -Self:SELF.enable_key_repeat (:INTEGER,:INTEGER)
        Enable/Disable keyboard repeat. Keyboard repeat defaults to off. is the initial delay in ms between the time when a key is pressed, and keyboard repeat begins. is the time in ms between keyboard repeat events. If is set to 0, keyboard repeat is disabled.

Public

    -Self:SELF.set_defaut_key_repeat
        Set good default value provided by the SDL library

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_key_repeat:(INTEGER,INTEGER)
        Get and values

Public

    -Self:SELF.previous_state:INTEGER
        Previous unicode state

Public

    -Self:SELF.enable_unicode :INTEGER :INTEGER
        Enable/Disable UNICODE translation of keyboard input. This translation has some overhead, so translation defaults off. If is 1, translation is enabled. If is 0, translation is disabled. If is -1, the translation state is not changed. This function set the slot

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_mod_state:INTEGER
        Get the current key modifier state

Public

    -Self:SELF.set_mod_state :INTEGER
        Set the current key modifier state. This does not change the keyboard state, only the key modifier flags.

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_key_name :INTEGER :STRING
        Get the name of an SDL virtual keysym

Public

    -Self:SELF.get_key_state:FAST_ARRAY(UINTEGER_8)
        Memory buffer of the current keyboard. Get a snapshot of the current state of the keyboard. Returns an array of keystates, indexed by the SDLK_
        syms
